results.title: Drinking driving: Danger level
results.brief_description: Examines the effect of alcohol on driving performance. Scientific tests were carried out at Warwick Farm motor racing circuit, using drivers given carefully measured quantities of alcohol. From the results of these experiments, a danger level of alcohol consumption was able to be ascertained.

results.title: Dream
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: A partly animated film based on a series of drypoint prints (‘Movements’ and ‘Combats’) by Australian printmaker Charles Lloyd on the theme of aggression in society. The sound composition by Arthur Cantrill is a mix of percussion and altered piano (plucking and hitting strings and soundboard, played by Arthur Cantrill), sound effects (including breathing), and electronically modified children’s laughter, recorded on a Nagra reel to reel tape recorder and transferred to 16mm magnetic tracks which were laid and mixed in a professional sound studio, where reverberation was added to some sections.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.creator_credit: Christopher Mann and Bede College, Durham
results.brief_description: An example of student filmmaking; set in Durham it tells the story of two fashion cameramen, during which both lose certain illusions.

results.title: Double trouble
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson, Geoffrey Bell and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Designed to establish cordial relations between Australians and migrants from Europe. Two Australian who criticise the newcomers’ lack of English find themselves in serious difficulties when magically transported to a foreign country.

results.title: The Double helix
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville, Anvil Films and EFVA
results.brief_description: Part of the Nobel Laureates series. Shows the work of several scientists in determining the structure of deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA). Uses animated diagrams to illustrate the structure of DNA. Discusses the significance of DNA in all living organisms. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Double-decked 'strato' clipper
results.creator_credit: MPO Productions and Pan American World Airways
results.brief_description: Designed to acquaint the public with the facilities provided for speedy and comfortable air travel by modern airliners, this film observes the operation of a Boeing double-decked airliner, the “Strato-cruiser”. Includes also an account of the development of trans-oceanic air travel and of the Boeing/Pan Am aircraft, pre and post WWII.

results.title: [This week in Britain. Don't shoot the pianist]
results.brief_description: A segment from ‘This Week in Britain’ discussing the work of the National Film Archive, a division of the British Film Institute, in collecting and preserving film for posterity. Explains the problems associated with storing nitrate film, the procedures used for copying old film, and video taping.

results.title: Don't push your luck
results.brief_description: A dramatic eye safety film featuring Bill Frank of Chicago, Illinois, a genuine eye accident casualty who re-enacts the events before and after his injury. A variety of typical work situations where eye injuries can occur are shown and impact tests are used to recommend the use of protective eyewear. Some members of the Wise Owls Club show the effectiveness of safety glass in preventing injury.

results.title: Don't lose your grip
results.creator_credit: Joan Hansen, R.D. Hansen, Fortune Film Productions and New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1961 film illustrates safe methods for handling and storage of rolled steel joists, angles and plates in steel yards. Accompanied by an instructional narration, the film opens with a dramatised scene of an injured man caught beneath a steel beam due to the carelessness of a workmate. It shows footage of correct methods of stacking and storing steel beams, angles and plates, as well as demonstrating correct use of lifting equipment.

Produced by Fortune Film Productions and the New South Wales Department of Labour and Industry.

There are several jumps in the soundtrack throughout the film due to missing frames.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Dockside
results.brief_description: Three major sequences deal with current developments in cargo handling; the giant cranes that take containerized cargo from hold to truck trailer, conveyer slings and belts that speed cartons, and the unloading of automobiles in a breathtaking aerial ballet. Shows the rich swirl of human activity around a port.
